div.a: Board of Education adopts virtual meeting guidelines
div.span: Wednesday, April 15, 2020

The Ottawa Hills Board of Education adopted a resolution Tuesday (April 14) allowing it to meet “virtually” during the COVID-19 crisis. The board’s vote maintains its obligations as a “public body” to meet in open session while also complying ...

div.a: Sun Federal extends teacher award deadline
div.span: Friday, April 10, 2020
Members of the OH community who want to nominate a teacher for Sun Federal Credit Union's "Extraordinary Teacher of the Year Award" now have more time.

div.a: How one family makes remote learning work
div.span: Friday, April 10, 2020

Families in Ottawa Hills are making adjustments to their weekday schedules–and sometimes physical arrangements of their homes–to make sure the district’s new Remote Learning Plan works. That challenge is perhaps greatest for larger families such as the ...

div.a: Family check-in: Keeping rhythm with the Leeds
div.span: Friday, April 17, 2020

One thing is for sure about the Leeds’ home during the stay-at-home order: Headphones are always nearby! That’s because dad (Michael) is the instrumental music director at the Junior/Senior High School.

div.a: College Board cancels May 2, June 6 SATs
div.span: Monday, April 13, 2020
The College Board has canceled the May 2 and June 6 SAT administrations. Refunds will be provided to all students who are registered for May.

div.a: COVID-19 forces early end to study-abroad experiences
div.span: Thursday, April 9, 2020

The COVID-19 crisis has cut short the school year of two international students at Ottawa Hills: Mamadou Sy (Senegal) and Federico Celauro (Italy). The juniors returned to their host countries in the past two weeks.

div.a: Digital investments help remote learning efforts
div.span: Friday, April 3, 2020

Nearly seven years ago, Ottawa Hills Local Schools made a decision to go digital in two big ways: by adopting a suite of education products from Google and launching “OH Global” to eventually put a computer in every student’s hands. As the COVID-19 crisis ...

div.a: OHSAA delays spring sports through May 1
div.span: Friday, April 3, 2020

In conjunction with the new school-building closure deadline, the Ohio High School Athletic Association (OHSAA) postponed the start of spring sports. OHSAA extended the coaches’ no-contact period through May 1. OHSAA added that the no-contact regulation was not ...

div.a: AP exams will go on! Here are the details
div.span: Friday, April 3, 2020

Nearly 40 percent of OH students in grades 9-12 are currently enrolled in at least one Advanced Placement (AP) course. But the COVID-19 crisis and its disruptive effect on school operations is raising questions about this year’s AP exams.
Thursday, April 2, 2020
With the COVID-19 extension now in place through May 1 across Ohio, it is time to unveil our plan and schedule for your student(s) for the next four weeks.

div.a: An important district update from Dr. Fineske
div.span: Sunday, March 29, 2020

I hope this email finds all of you safe and healthy. As the so-called "Spring Break" for our families draws to a close (officially tomorrow evening), I hope everyone found time (probably in ways very different than in the past!) to get much needed rest and ...
Friday, March 27, 2020

img.alt: Signer at daily Ohio press conference

div.span: COVID-19 news conferences can be found just about any time on TV and Internet. And many, including the daily one by Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine, are shining a spotlight on the interpreters making the news accessible to the deaf.
